    Paper Flow

    Danilo Sarti

    2022-11-15

    paper_flow.Rmd
    library(frons)

    Simulating BLUEs 

    sim_blues=sim_blue_model(pars = list(I = 4,J=3,Z=3,R=2,u_treat=0,sigma_treat=1,u_gen=0,
                                    sigma_gen=1,u_block=0,sigma_block=1,u_pb=0,sigma_pb=1, u_gp=0, sigma_gp=1,u_mean=0,sigma_mean=1,u_epsilon=0, sigma_epsilon=1
))
head(sim_blues$test_df)[1:3,1:4]
    ##   treatment_label genotype_label block_label treatment_effect
## 1     treatment_1     genotype_1     block_1       -0.3069534
## 2     treatment_2     genotype_1     block_1        0.2425481
## 3     treatment_3     genotype_1     block_1        1.6643951

    Simulating from Model 1

    setting global parameters required by the model 

    # setting global parameters
I=2#number of genotypes
J=3 #number of environments 
K=10 # envirnmental covariates
# simulating a matrix of markers w_a
#WA= markes columns individual rows 0,1,2
#0- AA, 1-Aa, 2aa.
n_markers=600
marker_label=sprintf("marker_%s",seq(1:n_markers))
markers_expression=c(0,1,2)
data_expression=sample(markers_expression,n_markers*I,replace = TRUE)
w_a=matrix(data_expression,nrow=I,ncol = n_markers)
colnames(w_a)=marker_label
rownames(w_a)=gen_label=sprintf("genotype_%s",seq(1:I))
# we must calculate now the $2 \sum_{l}^{n} p_{l}\left(1-p_{l}\right)$


## generate a matrix of environmental relationship
n_env_cov=3
env_cov_label=sprintf("env_cov_%s",seq(1:n_env_cov))
env_lab=sprintf("environment_%s",seq(1:J))
envs_expression=rnorm(100)
data_env=sample(envs_expression,n_env_cov*J,replace = TRUE)
x_env=matrix(data_env,nrow=J,ncol = n_env_cov)
colnames(x_env)=env_cov_label
rownames(x_env)=env_lab

u_mean=100
sigma_mean=20
sigma_ag=1
u_env=0
sigma_env=1 
u_epsilon=0 
sigma_epsilon=1
u_gen=0
u_mean=0
sigma_ge=1
u_ge=0
sigma_w=1
u_w=0
sigma_aw=1
    sim_m1=sim_m1(pars=list(w_a=w_a,u_mean=0,sigma_mean=1, sigma_ag=1,u_env=0,sigma_env=1, u_epsilon=0, sigma_epsilon=1,J=3,I=2,u_gen=1))

head(sim_m1$test_df)
    ##   environment_label genotype_label gen_effect env_effect    epsilon         mu
## 1     environment_1     genotype_1  1.0369648  0.3357055 -0.4668736 -0.1011437
## 2     environment_2     genotype_1  1.0369648  0.2534056 -0.7876264 -0.1011437
## 3     environment_3     genotype_1  1.0369648  0.1044997 -0.7747632 -0.1011437
## 4     environment_1     genotype_2  0.9692844  0.3357055 -2.9404466 -0.1011437
## 5     environment_2     genotype_2  0.9692844  0.2534056  1.2181127 -0.1011437
## 6     environment_3     genotype_2  0.9692844  0.1044997  2.6371234 -0.1011437

## 1  0.8046530
## 2  0.4016003

## 5  2.3396590

    Simulating from model 2 

    m_2=sim_m2(pars=list(I=I,J=J,w_a=w_a,sigma_ag=sigma_ag,u_mean=u_mean,sigma_mean=sigma_mean,u_env=u_env,sigma_env=sigma_env, u_gen=u_gen,sigma_env=sigma_env,sigma_ge=sigma_ge,u_ge=u_ge,sigma_ge=sigma_ge,u_epsilon=u_epsilon,sigma_epsilon=sigma_epsilon))

    Simulating from Model 3: 

    m_3=sim_m3(pars=list(I=I,J=J,K=K,w_a=w_a,sigma_ag=sigma_ag,u_mean=u_mean,sigma_mean=sigma_mean,u_env=u_env,sigma_env=sigma_env, u_gen=u_gen,sigma_env=sigma_env,u_epsilon=u_epsilon,sigma_epsilon=sigma_epsilon, x_env=x_env,sigma_w=sigma_w,u_w=u_w))
